SWAYAM

The SWAYAM Programme was established under the aegis of the Ministry of Human Resources Development, Government of India, for expanding educational access and opportunities courses and pedagogies. Swayam courses cover all subjects and skill sectors from high school to higher education. SWAYAM seeks to bridge the digital divide for students who have hitherto remained untouched by the digital revolution and have not been able to join the mainstream of the knowledge economy. SWAYAM designed to achieve the three cardinal principles of Education Policy viz., access, equity and quality.

Through SWAYAM integrated learning platform courses from India’s top-ranking institutions and faculty are made available to learners anywhere in an asynchronous mode.

All courses on the Swayam platform are free. Learners, if they are students currently enrolled in an educational institution or university, have also the option of transferring credits earned through the SWAYAM courses to their respective home institutions.

SWAYAM Objective

The objective of SWAYAM effort is to take the best teaching learning resources to all, including the most disadvantaged

  • To bridge the digital divide for students who have hitherto remained untouched by the digital revolution and have not been able to join the mainstream of the knowledge economy
  • To provide one-stop web and mobile based interactive e-content for all courses from High School to University level
  • To provide high quality learning experience using multimedia on an anytime, anywhere basis
  • To provide state of the art system that allows easy access, monitoring and certification
  • To provide peer interaction and discussion forum to clarify doubts

Four Quadrant Approach

The four Quadrant approach implies an e-learning system that has the following components:

  • Video Lecture
  • Reading Material
  • Self-Assessment Tests
  • Online Discussion

Examination

Timed and proctored examinations are conducted twice every year; in April/ May and December for Management courses. The details of the examination will be communicated to students through the SWAYAM Website. The details of Exam dates, time, venue, procedure to apply for exam, the status of application, hall tickets and results will also be communicated through the SWAYAM Website

SWAYAM Website: https://swayam.gov.in

IIMB on SWAYAM

IIMB is one of the nine national coordinators and has offered more than 20 courses on SWAYAM since 2017. As a National Coordinator, IIMB receives and evaluates MOOC (Massive Open Online Course) proposals in the area of management studies from Universities and Institutions willing to offer their course on SWAYAM. Universities and Institutions can send the proposals to IIMBx, the digital learning division of IIM Bangalore.

To Know More: Click Here

National Coordinators

In order to ensuer best quality content nine national coordinators have been appointed. These are

Coordinators
  • AICTE

    For Self-paced and International courses
  • CEC

    For Under graduate Education
  • IGNOU

    For Diplomas and Certificates Programmes
  • IIMB

    For Management Programmes
  • NCERT

    For School graduation Education from class 9th to 12th
  • NIOS

    For Out of School Children Educational Programme from class 9th to 12th
  • NITTR

    For Teacher Training Programme
  • NPTEL

    For Engineering
  • UGC

    For Non-technical Post graduation Education
